item.title: John add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: John add a quote by Norton Juster
item.description: "It has been a long trip," said Milo, climbing onto the couch where the princesses sat; "but we would have been here much sooner if I hadn't made so many mistakes. I'm afraid it's all my fault." "You must never feel badly about making mistakes," explained Reason quietly, "as long as you take the trouble to learn from them. For you often learn more by being wrong for the right reasons than you do by being right for the wrong reasons." -- Norton Juster

item.title: John add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "The ancient Greek definition of happiness was the full use of your powers along lines of excellence." -- John F. Kennedy
